Package chess23

Class King

java.lang.Object
chess23.Piece
chess23.King
public class King
extends chess23.Piece
Class representing a king in chess.

  • Field Details

    • castleCoordKingK

      private chess23.Coordinate castleCoordKingK
      The Coordinate to which the king goes after castling kingside.

    • castleCoordKingQ

      private chess23.Coordinate castleCoordKingQ
      The Coordinate to which the king goes after castling queenside.

    • transitionCoordKingK

      private chess23.Coordinate transitionCoordKingK
      The Coordinate through which the king goes when castling kingside. This is used to ensure that if we castle, we do so without being checked.

    • transitionCoordKingQ

      private chess23.Coordinate transitionCoordKingQ
      The Coordinate through which the king goes when castling queenside. This is used to ensure that if we castle, we do so without being checked.

    • rookKing

      private chess23.Rook rookKing
      The Rook on the kingside.

    • rookQueen

    • canCastleKing

      public boolean canCastleKing​(chess23.Pieces pieces)
      Determines whether a King can castle kingside (short castling).
      Parameters:
      pieces - the Pieces used for playing.
      Returns:
      true if and only if we adhere to the principle "one may not castle out of, through, or into check.":
      • the King isn't in check,
      • there is a Rook on the kingside (h1 for white, h8 for black),
      • there are no pieces between the King and the Rook
      • neither the kingside Rook nor the King have moved
      If the King can castle, then castleCoordKingK and transitionCoordKingK are updated.
      It also updates the moves of the kingside Rook to include castling.

    • canCastleQueen

      public boolean canCastleQueen​(chess23.Pieces pieces)
      Determines whether a King can castle queenside (long castling).
      Parameters:
      pieces - the Pieces used for playing.
      Returns:
      true if and only if we adhere to the principle "one may not castle out of, through, or into check.":
      • the King isn't in check,
      • there is a Rook on the queenside (a1 for white, a8 for black),
      • there are no pieces between the King and the Rook
      • neither the queenside Rook nor the King have moved
      If the King can castle, then castleCoordKingQ and transitionCoordKingQ are updated.
      It also updates the moves of the queenside Rook to include castling.
